availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Lisle (Marion County, Kentucky, attorney & captain 10th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas W. Lisle and Nancy Jane C. Tate Lisle. Married to Addie Lisle. Father of Nettie Lisle. Resident of Green County in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Attorney with James M. Fogle and Andrew Barnett in Marion County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as an adjutant and captain from November 21, 1861, to April 19, 1863.

ab.bibl:

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 806-08.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 935.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016134, All County Deaths, File #15956, p. 2664 of 3295 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
